Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural habitats.
The student can label the places where different plants and animals live (e.g., forests, water bodies, fields).
The student can illustrate and label what plants and animals need to survive (e.g., water, air, sunlight, soil).
The student can show the relationship between plants/animals and their resources (e.g., fish swimming in water, plants growing with sunlight).
The student can depict how the environment provides resources for plants and animals (e.g., forests provide leaves and buds for deer).
The student can demonstrate how plants and animals and their habitats form a system working together to meet their needs.
